alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 14 at 3:19PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following areas, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...Until 3 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. The Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon burn scar will be especially susceptible to heavy rainfall and excessive runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Increased moisture and numerous thunderstorms are expected to repeatedly move over areas within the Flood Watch today and tonight. Heavy rainfall rates may lead to abrupt and rapid runoff, especially over areas impacted by the Hermits Peak- Calf Canyon wildfire. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
